72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:28): Gman: Most folks I know running solaris to large extents are doing so in situations where they're stuck on 8, or in some cases 7.
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (13:28): richlowe, nod - but then it's even worse
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (13:28): comparing a X year old OS to what's currently available in the linux world
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:28): conversation tends to run similar to.  "It's like linux... but 5 years ago", "No, it's like Solaris was, 5 years ago, or more".
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:28): "ah"
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:28): repeat ad infinitum.
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (13:30): they should try running linux on some decent mp hardware and then they'd see what solaris has to offer
13d302032f9ecb786adfb94061757afc (13:31): wow that guy has issues with Sun and the english language...
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (13:31): though he's right, sunw needs a bit of work :)
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (13:32): cyrille, shouldn't that be langwage ;-)
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:33): Gman: you guys just aren't exciting enough.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:33): Gman: we all know it's eye candy that brings folks in.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:33): Gman: and that's your dept. :)
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (13:33): yeah, that much is completely true
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (13:33): we've talked about that quite a bit already
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (13:33): thing is the stuff we want to do invariably depends on other groups
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (13:34): that is somewhat outside our scope and experience level
13d302032f9ecb786adfb94061757afc (13:34): the eye candy division?
53e86cb71746c2a78d3aaf322da11ffc (13:35): piling on too much eye candy just risks alienating those of us who aren't looking for a pretty desktop
13d302032f9ecb786adfb94061757afc (13:36): ah, come on, wouldn't you prefer a crawling slow desktop, but with an animated paperclip telling you what you want to do? ;-)
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:36): quasi: I'd think most of us used to having to kill that stuff already.
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (13:36): Well if you can't run your obscure geeky desktop then the OS is cr@p :-)
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:36): and apparently I'm randomly missing words out.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:36): feel free to play it like madlibs :)
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (13:37): quasi, Cyrille: I'm not saying eyecandy attracting people is sensible by the way, just that's the way it tends to work. :)

53e86cb71746c2a78d3aaf322da11ffc (13:49): richlowe: I'm not saying that it isn't, I'm just saying that I don't think it helps to try hiding os details, that might not have been implemented in the smartest way possible when they were introduced in 2.5, behind a 500M java thing that doesn't really do more than flip a switch
